channel.title: attack.defense_evasion on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.defense_evasion on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Winnti Pipemon Characteristics
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti Pipemon malware reported by ESET

item.title: Avusing Azure Browser SSO
item.description: Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser. An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.

item.title: Empire UserAgent URI Combo
item.description: Detects user agent and URI paths used by empire agents

item.title: Regsvr32 Flags Anomaly
item.description: Detects a flag anomaly in which regsvr32.exe uses a /i flag without using a /n flag at the same time

item.title: Connection Proxy
item.description: Detects setting proxy

item.title: EvilNum Golden Chickens Deployment via OCX Files
item.description: Detects Golden Chickens deployment method as used by Evilnum in report published in July 2020

item.title: Explorer Root Flag Process Tree Break
item.description: Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe /root, which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer

item.title: Windows Defender Threat Detection Disabled
item.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender threat protection

item.title: Disabled IE Security Features
item.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

item.title: Ke3chang Registry Key Modifications
item.description: Detects Registry modifcations performaed by Ke3chang malware in campaigns running in 2019 and 2020

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll

item.title: Wsreset UAC Bypass
item.description: Detects a method that uses Wsreset.exe tool that can be used to reset the Windows Store to bypass UAC

item.title: FromBase64String Command Line
item.description: Detects suspicious FromBase64String expressions in command line arguments

item.title: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64
item.description: Detects a renamed dctask64.exe used for process injection, command execution, process creation with a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation

item.title: ZOHO Dctask64 Process Injection
item.description: Detects suspicious process injection using ZOHO’s dctask64.exe

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Suspect Svchost Activity
item.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: Renamed ProcDump
item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable often used by attackers or malware

item.title: Cisco Clear Logs
item.description: Clear command history in network OS which is used for defense evasion

item.title: Cisco Crypto Commands
item.description: Show when private keys are being exported from the device, or when new certificates are installed

item.title: Cisco Disabling Logging
item.description: Turn off logging locally or remote

item.title: Cisco File Deletion
item.description: See what files are being deleted from flash file systems

item.title: Suspicious MsiExec Directory
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts in an uncommon directory

item.title: Masquerading as Linux Crond Process
item.description: Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an executable, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation. Several different variations of this technique have been observed.

item.title: Suspicious Remote Thread Created
item.description: Offensive tradecraft is switching away from using APIs like “CreateRemoteThread”, however, this is still largely observed in the wild. This rule aims to detect suspicious processes (those we would not expect to behave in this way like word.exe or outlook.exe) creating remote threads on other processes. It is a generalistic rule, but it should have a low FP ratio due to the selected range of processes.

item.title: Suspicious In-Memory Module Execution
item.description: Detects the access to processes by other suspicious processes which have reflectively loaded libraries in their memory space. An example is SilentTrinity C2 behaviour. Generally speaking, when Sysmon EventID 10 cannot reference a stack call to a dll loaded from disk (the standard way), it will display “UNKNOWN” as the module name. Usually this means the stack call points to a module that was reflectively loaded in memory. Adding to this, it is not common to see such few calls in the stack (ntdll.dll –> kernelbase.dll –> unknown) which essentially means that most of the functions required by the process to execute certain routines are already present in memory, not requiring any calls to external libraries. The latter should also be considered suspicious.

item.title: Clear PowerShell History
item.description: Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history

item.title: New or Renamed User Account with '$' in Attribute 'SamAccountName'.
item.description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.

item.title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services “svchost.exe -k netsvcs” to gain code execution on a remote machine.

item.title: Bypass UAC via CMSTP
item.description: Detect child processes of automatically elevated instances of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe).

item.title: HH.exe Execution
item.description: Identifies usage of hh.exe executing recently modified .chm files.

item.title: Indirect Command Execution
item.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcalua.exe or forfiles.exe

item.title: Modification of ld.so.preload
item.description: Identifies modification of ld.so.preload for shared object injection. This technique is used by attackers to load arbitrary code into processes.

item.title: Mshta JavaScript Execution
item.description: Identifies suspicious mshta.exe commands

item.title: Suspicious Bitsadmin Job via PowerShell
item.description: Detect download by BITS jobs via PowerShell

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.exe
item.description: Execute C# code located in the consoleapp folder

item.title: Possible App Whitelisting Bypass via WinDbg/CDB as a Shellcode Runner
item.description: Launch 64-bit shellcode from a debugger script file using cdb.exe.

item.title: Windows Defender Exclusion Set
item.description: Detects scenarios where an windows defender exclusion was added in registry where an entity would want to bypass antivirus scanning from windows defender

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Bginfo
item.description: Execute VBscript code that is referenced within the *.bgi file.

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dxcap.exe
item.description: Detects execution of of Dxcap.exe

item.title: Application Whitelisting Bypass via DLL Loaded by odbcconf.exe
item.description: Detects defence evasion attempt via odbcconf.exe execution to load DLL

item.description: Detect changes in auditd configuration files

item.description: Detect changes of syslog daemons configuration files

item.description: Detects network connections and DNS queries initiated by Regsvr32.exe

item.description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object

item.title: CreateRemoteThread API and LoadLibrary
item.description: Detects potential use of CreateRemoteThread api and LoadLibrary function to inject DLL into a process

item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of fDenyTSConnections and UserAuthentication to enable remote desktop connections.

item.description: Detects file and folder permission changes

item.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

item.title: Suspicious Csc.exe Source File Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious execution of csc.exe, which uses a source in a suspicious folder (e.g. AppData)

item.title: Encoded FromBase64String
item.description: Detects a base64 encoded FromBase64String keyword in a process command line

item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed PowerShell often used by attackers or malware

item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

item.description: Detects the execution of a renamed PsExec often used by attackers or malware

item.description: Clear command history in linux which is used for defense evasion.

item.description: Detection for mshta.exe suspicious execution patterns sometimes involving file polyglotism

item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects

item.description: Detects process starts of binaries from a suspicious folder

item.description: Detects a suspicious exection from an uncommon folder

item.description: Detects the creation of a executable with a system process name in a suspicious folder

item.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

item.description: Detects invocation of Microsoft Workflow Compiler, which may permit the execution of arbitrary unsigned code.

item.description: Detects MSHTA.EXE spwaned by SVCHOST as seen in LethalHTA and described in report

item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addreses as parameter

item.title: NotPetya Ransomware Activity
item.description: Detects NotPetya ransomware activity in which the extracted passwords are passed back to the main module via named pipe, the file system journal of drive C is deleted and windows eventlogs are cleared using wevtutil

item.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

item.description: Detects execution of executables that can be used to bypass Applocker whitelisting

item.description: Detects Request to amsiInitFailed that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

item.description: Detects Base64 encoded Shellcode

item.description: Detects various anomalies in relation to regsvr32.exe

item.description: Detects WMI SquiblyTwo Attack with possible renamed WMI by looking for imphash

item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.description: Detects suspicious process that use escape characters

item.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: System File Execution Location Anomaly
item.description: Detects a Windows program executable started in a suspicious folder

item.description: Detects the creation of a process from Windows task manager

item.description: Detects WannaCry ransomware activity

item.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

item.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM

item.description: Detects Winword starting uncommon sub process MicroScMgmt.exe as used in exploits for CVE-2015-1641

item.title: Equation Group DLL_U Load
item.description: Detects a specific tool and export used by EquationGroup

item.title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing
item.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off “Local Group Policy Object Processing” via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as “gpedit.msc”. Please note, that disabling “Local Group Policy Object Processing” may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications – however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

item.title: Flash Player Update from Suspicious Location
item.description: Detects a flashplayer update from an unofficial location

item.title: Ps.exe Renamed SysInternals Tool
item.description: Detects renamed SysInternals tool execution with a binary named ps.exe as used by Dragonfly APT group and documented in TA17-293A report

item.title: ZxShell Malware
item.description: Detects a ZxShell start by the called and well-known function name

item.title: Secure Deletion with SDelete
item.description: Detects renaming of file while deletion with SDelete tool

item.title: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
item.description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)

item.title: DHCP Server Error Failed Loading the CallOut DLL
item.description: This rule detects a DHCP server error in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

item.title: DHCP Server Loaded the CallOut DLL
item.description: This rule detects a DHCP server in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) was loaded

item.title: Backup Catalog Deleted
item.description: Detects backup catalog deletions

item.title: PowerShell Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0

item.description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer

item.description: Detects Windows PowerShell Web Access

item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by “wevtutil cl” command execution

item.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

item.description: Detects a suspicious DLL loading from AppData Local path as described in BlueMashroom report

item.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.

item.description: Detects Malleable Amazon Profile

item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

item.title: CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
item.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

item.title: Dllhost Internet Connection
item.description: Detects Dllhost that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: DNS Server Error Failed Loading the ServerLevelPluginDLL
item.description: This rule detects a DNS server error in which a specified plugin DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

item.title: DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Install
item.description: Detects the installation of a plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

item.title: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

item.title: Emissary Panda Malware SLLauncher
item.description: Detects the execution of DLL side-loading malware used by threat group Emissary Panda aka APT27

item.title: Empire Monkey
item.description: Detects EmpireMonkey APT reported Activity

item.title: Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass
item.description: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods

item.title: Empty User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious empty user agent strings in proxy logs

item.title: Executable in ADS
item.description: Detects the creation of an ADS data stream that contains an executable (non-empty imphash)

item.title: Execution of Renamed PaExec
item.description: Detects execution of renamed paexec via imphash and executable product string

item.title: Failed Code Integrity Checks
item.description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.

item.title: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.

item.title: Findstr Launching .lnk File
item.description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack

item.title: Fireball Archer Install
item.description: Detects Archer malware invocation via rundll32

item.title: Firewall Disabled via Netsh
item.description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

item.title: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation
item.description: Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size..). Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: Lazarus Session Highjacker
item.description: Detects executables launched outside their default directories as used by Lazarus Group (Bluenoroff)

item.title: Malicious Named Pipe
item.description: Detects the creation of a named pipe used by known APT malware

item.title: Malware Shellcode in Verclsid Target Process
item.description: Detects a process access to verclsid.exe that injects shellcode from a Microsoft Office application / VBA macro

item.title: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash
item.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding

item.title: Netsh Port or Application Allowed
item.description: Allow Incoming Connections by Port or Application on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh Program Allowed with Suspcious Location
item.description: Detects Netsh commands that allows a suspcious application location on Windows Firewall

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Opening
item.description: Detects netsh commands that opens the port 3389 used for RDP, used in Sarwent Malware

item.title: Office Security Settings Changed
item.description: Detects registry changes to Office macro settings

item.title: Possible Process Hollowing Image Loading
item.description: Detects Loading of samlib.dll, WinSCard.dll from untypical process e.g. through process hollowing by Mimikatz

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: PowerShell Called from an Executable Version Mismatch
item.description: Detects PowerShell called from an executable by the version mismatch method

item.title: PowerShell Encoded Character Syntax
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: QBot Process Creation
item.description: Detects QBot like process executions

item.title: Raw Paste Service Access
item.description: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

item.title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
item.description: Detects changes to RDP terminal service sensitive settings

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Dropped File
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Renamed jusched.exe
item.description: Detects renamed jusched.exe used by cobalt group

item.title: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
item.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

item.title: Rundll32 Internet Connection
item.description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses

item.title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

item.title: Sofacy Trojan Loader Activity
item.description: Detects Trojan loader acitivty as used by APT28

item.title: Squirrel Lolbin
item.description: Detects Possible Squirrel Packages Manager as Lolbin

item.title: Suspect Svchost Memory Asccess
item.description: Detects suspect access to svchost process memory such as that used by Invoke-Phantom to kill the winRM windows event logging service.

item.title: Suspicious Calculator Usage
item.description: Detects suspicious use of calc.exe with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion

item.title: Suspicious Copy From or To System32
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command that copies a system program from System32 to another directory on disk - sometimes used to use LOLBINs like certutil or desktopimgdownldr to a different location with a different name

item.title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User
item.description: Detects the loading of drivers via ‘SeLoadDriverPrivilege’ required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

item.title: Suspicious Esentutl Use
item.description: Detects flags often used with the LOLBAS Esentutl for malicious activity. It could be used in rare cases by administrators to access locked files or during maintenance.

item.title: Suspicious Eventlog Clear or Configuration Using Wevtutil
item.description: Detects clearing or configuration of eventlogs uwing wevtutil, powershell and wmic. Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others)

item.title: Suspicious GUP Usage
item.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

item.title: Suspicious Parent of Csc.exe
item.description: Detects a suspicious parent of csc.exe, which could by a sign of payload delivery

item.title: Suspicious PROCEXP152.sys File Created In TMP
item.description: Detects the creation of the PROCEXP152.sys file in the application-data local temporary folder. This driver is used by Sysinternals Process Explorer but also by KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU) or Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU.

item.title: Suspicious Program Location Process Starts
item.description: Detects programs running in suspicious files system locations

item.title: Telegram API Access
item.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

item.title: Turla ComRAT
item.description: Detects Turla ComRAT patterns

item.title: Winnti Malware HK University Campaign
item.description: Detects specific process characteristics of Winnti malware noticed in Dec/Jan 2020 in a campaign against Honk Kong universities
